column4: Question: I have Ubuntu 11.10 on my laptop and no other OS. Is it easy to install a second 11.10 on some empty partition? What about grub? has somebody some experiences
Thanks all. The reason is. Somebody will obtain an Ubuntu installation from me. The person has no idea about computers. The second OS would be an emergency system ...
dr_willis, another option si sto install the bootloader of the second system in its own partition and not the disk mbr, that way you are chaining the bootloaders
well this is done like this via phone. I would even print out a photo which shows grub and what the person needs to do in an emergency case
the key is not to share /boot folder or the initramfs are going to be overwritten
you can use freenx or the closed source nx, i never used freenx but used the nx thing and it is so nice
i suggest you to, install the rescue system in its own partition, all, but maybe set a swap for it if the user use the main for hibernation
then install the grub in its partition and not the mbr
for remote assitance you are going to like openssh server there too, and also teamviewer and nx
I would install the whole bunch of software
don't share the /boot between both installs, because you are going to overwrite the initramfs of one wirth the other breaking the purpose of the rescue system or making the main unbootable
